title: 'One out... by mistake' and Prince Andrew 'dislodged'
description: The fallout after a former asylum seeker who assaulted a 14-year-old girl was mistakenly released from prison leads the papers.
content:
Many papers feature the Epping asylum seeker jailed for sexual assault who has been released from prison by mistake.
The Daily Telegraph calls it a "jail blunder", external, with the Daily Mail saying the error "beggars belief", external.

title: Thailand's former queen Sirikit dies aged 93
description: The mother of King Vajiralongkorn passed away "peacefully" on Friday night, according to the Thai Royal Household.
content:
Queen Sirikit, the mother of Thailand's King Vajiralongkorn, has died aged 93.
She passed away "peacefully" in a Bangkok hospital at 21:21 local time (14:21 GMT) on Friday, according to the Thai Royal Household Bureau.
Sirikit had "suffered several i... [2236 chars]

title: Britney Spears said she was used. Kevin Federline says she needs help
description: Decades later, the pop star's very public unravelling is back in the limelight - but what exactly happened and why depends on who is doing the retelling.
content:
Britney Spears stared at herself in a mirror, grinning as she grabbed an electric clipper.
Chunks of her long, iconic locks fell to the floor of the Southern California salon. Paparazzi cameras outside documented every second of the now-infamous nigh... [9181 chars]

title: Reeves should not cut cash ISA allowance, MPs say
description: The Chancellor is reportedly trying to revive plans to cut the tax-free limit for Cash ISAs.
content:
Chancellor Rachel Reeves should not cut the cash Isa tax-free allowance in the upcoming Budget, a group of MPs has strongly advised.
Cuts to the tax-free allowance were unlikely to have the intended effect of promoting an investment culture in the UK... [2246 chars]

title: Irish presidential election: Counting begins as ballot boxes open
description: Catherine Connolly and Heather Humphreys wait to find out who will replace Michael D Higgins and become Ireland's 10th president.
content:
Counting is under way in the Irish presidential election.
Voters in the Republic of Ireland went to the polls on Friday to elect the 10th Irish president, who will replace current head of state Michael D Higgins.
